fields.description: Currently, we don’t have many fields on the “View issue” screen, we only show some standard fields like "Summary", "Status", "Description", "Priority", "Reporter" and "Assignee" but other custom fields are not supported.
fields.summary: Issue view screen for Jira-Outlook add-on

fields.description:
h3. Problem
As of now, when using the issue statistics gadget, based on statuses, the statuses are displayed in random order.  It would be great to see if the statuses can be ordered according to the workflow process how a issue moves.

h3. Suggested Solution
A drag and drop of the statuses that can be displayed according to the users requirement would be great.

h3. Why This Is Important
 It can be easily recognized and shared with the higher management. Better visibility.

h3. Workaround
_(Add a workaround, if available)_
fields.summary: Issue statistics to have an option to drag and drop statuses in the required order

fields.description:
Currently, there is no out of the box feature in Jira to configure notifications to users for changes in project details.

Customers would like to have this feature configurable in the Jira cloud.
fields.summary: Notifications on changing the project details.

fields.description:
I really like the 'creating sub task'-feature in the main issue. The only down side is that I still have open alle subtasks individually to set the time remaining field. There is enough space for it, so you only have make it available on the beam (See a raw sketch in the attachment).

!image-2021-11-24-10-03-28-641.png!
fields.summary: Being able to fill in the 'Time remaining'-field in the 'creating sub task'-feature in the main issue

fields.description:
Filters that search based on a Fix Version or Affects Version break after the related version is renamed. 

Steps to reproduce:
 # Create a filter that searches for a matching Fix Version which is assigned to at least one issue
 # Using that filter returns the resulting matching issues as expected
 # Rename the Fix Version on that project
 # The filter will no longer return any results
h4.
fields.summary: Renaming a version breaks all related filters

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Using dynamic URLs for the images is causing a bug in the preview. When opening an image preview in a new tab, it will load normally. However, after the image preview was opened for the second time in a new tab, if the user tries to reload the first image preview will end up not loading due to the change of the URL. 

When using static URLs in the text area, this bug will affect it by not loading the images correctly.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open an image attachment from a Jira issue.
 # Open the image attachment with "Open Image in a New Tab".
 # In a second tab of the browser, open the image attachment with "Open Image in a New Tab" again.
 # Reload the second tab, the image will continue to work
 # Try reloading the first tab, the image will not be displayed with an issue.

h3. Expected Results

Be able to see the image attachment in the preview even with the dynamic URL, or by using static URLs.
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the first tab of the browser when reloading:
{noformat}
Your issue couldn't be accessed
It may have been moved, edited or deleted
ERR_FILE_NOT_FOUND{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Use static URLs, or another method to resolve the issue.
fields.summary: Using dynamic URLs for images in Jira causes preview bug

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The Jira cloud only allows adding a group of viewers but not editors as the Jira Server one can have.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 #  Filter for JIRA Cloud.   !image-2021-11-23-19-37-56-333.png|width=209,height=150!
 # Filter for JIRA Server.      !image-2021-11-23-19-38-27-680.png|width=208,height=120!

h3. Expected Results

JIRA cloud should have Editor and Add Editors field while editing filter.
h3. Actual Results

Jira cloud has only added groups of viewers however not editors.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior.
fields.summary: Editors is not added to filters

fields.description: As a user, I was able to easily add projects or filters to my chat on teams when creating issues. Now, this is not possible. Also, whenever I commented on an issue there used to be a link that is automatically linked to the chat where the activity took place. This is no longer available. It would be much better if the same feature that existed prior to the upgrade to the Microsoft teams app for Jira is still available.
fields.summary: Provide the same feature that existed on the Microsoft teams app for Jira

fields.description:
Currently, only a standard set of fields like "Project", "Issue Type", "Summary", "Description", "Priority", "Assignee" are supported and available in the JIRA issue creation form. 

Hence, if there are any *_REQUIRED_* fields in the Jira issue create screen, the issue creation will fail and the following error will appear: “(field name) is required”

Please support the *_REQUIRED_* fields in the MS Teams for Jira issue creation.
fields.summary: Support for required fields for Jira issue creation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When a webhook is configured to the workflow to trigger on transition, the transition from the webhook doesn't return issuelinks value anymore as the "issuelinks": [] key in the payload is an empty list. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a webhook from your *Settings > System > Webhooks*
 # Create a webhook for issue created and save
 # Go to your *Project settings > workflows* and configure a workflow post function to "Trigger a webhook"
# Select the webhook you just created and click add

h3. Expected Results
When an issue is created with issue link added on the issue during creation and it triggers this webhook. We should receive in our webhook receiver a payload that should contain the issue link values.

h3. Actual Results
The webhook is received but is missing the issue link values and shows as an empty list "issuelinks": [] in the payload.


h3. Workaround
This is more prominent when using Azure data factory, the transition webhook payload returned doesn't show the issue link value. As an alternative, you can configure your webhook to use *issue_updated* events and use automation for Jira to update a field when an issue is created e.g. Labels and add a value (any value you can identify with). Therefore,  an issue updated event is triggered to the webhook which should contain the issue link.
fields.summary: Transition webhook via post function missing issue link value

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In the *Activity stream* gadget, if the results limit is set above 90, the gadget fails to load with a message 'The activity source for Jira as slow to respond and isnt included'

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Create a dashboard and add the *Activity stream* gadget
* In the gadget configuration, set the limit to 99 items
* Load the gadget and check the results

h3. Expected Results
The activity stream gadget should load when the limit is set to 99 without any issues

h3. Actual Results
Gadget fails to load with a message 'The activity source for Jira as slow to respond and isnt included'

h3. Workaround
Reducing the limit to a lower number would work
fields.summary: Activity stream gadget fails to load if the results limit is set to 99

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If a project only contains Epics, the quick creation of an Epic Child is not displaying any error.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a project with only Epic at the Issue Types
# Create an Epic
# Try to quick create a new Epic Child 
# There is no error displayed to the end-user

h3. Expected Results
A pop-up message explaining that there are no Issue Types to create child Issues on the Epic.

h3. Actual Results
Child issues can't be created and there is no error message displayed.


h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: No error message is displayed when unable to create an Epic child in the project having only Epic issue type

fields.description: Currently, the Teams are visible for all users under the same domain. However, there are companies that have multiple domains. In this case, it would be great to be able to share a team with the entire organization that contains multiple domains.
fields.summary: Create a team for one organization with multiple domains

fields.description:
Currently, the fields you choose to display in your list will only be visible to you. All users with access to the project can select their own fields to display.

*Expectation:*

It would be great if there is an ability to control fields + shown in the List view for a group of users in a project.
fields.summary: Ability to control fields + shown in List view for a group of users in a project

fields.description: It would be nice if plans for Jira, Confluence and other products could be defined seperatly for each user. For example Standard plan for common users, premium for managers(managers would like to have acces for advenced roadmaps). For example a company has 100 standard users and 10 managers. Now I have to buy premium license for 110 user. Only 10 of them will be using premium features. I think that should be changed.
fields.summary: Standard and Premium plan defined separately for each user

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Automations with JQLs that return multiple tickets (~300+) have a long duration, due to that it's possible for the JQL to make a ticket multiple times, making the automation attempt to execute the rule more than once in a single request.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 
Not reproduced 100% of the times

# Have a scheduled event that returns multiple issues ~300+
# Add 2 actions on the automation, one to make a transition, then one to make a comment

h3. Expected Results

The transition is executed only once and only one comment is added.

h3. Actual Results


The automation tries to execute the transition multiple times, and multiple comments are added.

Note: In an automation with around ~350 requests, only one issue had more than one execution.

h3. Workaround

A possible workaround on this case is to make the filter more specific, or even make the Schedule trigger more frequent, to make the batches of tickets smaller.
fields.summary: Automations with a high cost JQL (long duration) can lead to multiple executions in the same request

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
While importing issues via CSV, the timestamp in 24-hour format gets imported incorrectly.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Export an issue with comment timestamp in 24-hour format, for example, 12:47:00 (without AM/PM)
# Import the issue via CSV and map the comment field with *Comment body* and while importing set the date format to *hh.mm.ss*
# Check the timestamp shown in issue comments

h3. Expected Results
The issue comment time format should be set correctly (in this case, 12:47 PM)

h3. Actual Results
The timestamp is incorrect (shows as 12:47 AM) 

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Incorrect time stamp while importing issues via CSV import

fields.description: When I work with backlog grooming across multiple boards I tend to swap back and forth between multiple backlogs. If I do that now, I am defaulted to the actual board each time I switch. I would like the switch toggle to remember that I am in "backlog grooming mode" and stay at backlog (or roadmap for that matter) when I toggle between boards.
fields.summary: As a product manager I would like my selected board view to be remembered when I switch between boards

fields.description:
*Issue:* If you set a rule({_}Remind people to update empty fields{_}) in a TeamMannaged workflow to make it mandatory to have some value in the assignee field, at this moment a user can bypass this rule by selecting the '{*}unassigned'{*} value for the assignee field.

Check the screenshot and video attached below:
!image-2021-11-22-12-14-56-482.png|width=246,height=147!
 * [^remind rule in TeamManaged project.mov]

*Suggested resolution:* The system should not accept '{*}unassigned{*}' as a valid non-empty value for the workflow rule in the TeamManaged project.
fields.summary: Remind people to update empty fields : Unassigned should not be considered as a valid non-empty value in Team Managed workflow

fields.description:
h1. ProForma: Forms & Checklist for Jira

When it can be possible to use proforma in Jira Cloud ?
fields.summary: ProForma: Forms & Checklist for Jira Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Only on Ubuntu, in the comments section, the drop down of selected users after typing the first character does not change when @mentioning someone with a Korean name. The drop down list of selected users when @mention of a Korean name works in the description section, but not the comment section. 

This was tested on:

Ubuntu: 18.04 and 20.04
Chrome version: Version 95.0.4638.69 (Official Build) (64-bit)
Firefox: 90.0 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Start Firefox on Ubuntu
 # Open an existing issue
 # Try to @mention someone with a Korean name in the comments section, the drop down list will not change

h3. Expected Results

The drop down list should filter out people starting with the first Korean letter entered. 
h3. Actual Results

The drop down list of names does not change
h3. Workaround

@mention the full Korean name with an open parenthesis e.g. @
안녕하십니까(
fields.summary: When trying to @ mention someone with a Korean name in the comments section, the drop down of users is not changing after typing the first character

fields.description:
I have had a request from an agent who would like the option to select which comments are viewable in the JIRA Service Desk.
Maybe a radio button that would display Customer Only/Internal Only/All comments
This would be helpful to see what interactions have occurred with the customer without all the internal comments being listed in the timeline.

Cheers
Garth
fields.summary: Option to view Customer Only/Internal Only/All Comments

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The *Filter Results* macro becomes irresponsive if we select certain fields for example *Start date* , *% Completion* .
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a *Filter results* macro on a page.
 # Click edit to add fields in the macro.
 # Select field *Start date* from the dropdown list.
 # Click again the dropdown list to look for other fields to be added.

h3. Expected Results

The Filter results macro should display other fields to be added.
h3. Actual Results

The Filter results macro becomes irresponsive, and no other field can be selected to add .

!image-2020-10-02-17-38-12-306.png|width=186,height=114!
h3. !Screen Recording 2021-02-25 at 04.34.31 PM.gif|width=239,height=115!
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no workaround available.
fields.summary: Filter result macro doesn't respond to certain fields

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
there's a group called system-administrators that shows up on Global permission and project permission, however, the group is hidden on the administration page


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # open global permission
 # open group's administration

h3. Expected Results
Be able to delete the group or remove it from global permissions 

h3. Actual Results
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: system-administrators is showing up on permission but the group is invisible in "Manage groups"

fields.description: we would like to have a quick filter available for Team-managed boards, right it is only available for company-managed boards.
fields.summary: Include quick filter for Team-managed boards

fields.description: Currently the URL of the default *Application Navigator* cannot be edited. It shows a different URL from the *Switch to* options.
fields.summary: Ability to edit the default Application Navigator URL

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

There's an existing action in Automation that allows setting entity properties:
!image-2021-11-19-15-58-17-544.png!

But it's not possible to delete the entity properties using this action. You can just set the property to NULL, but it will keep existing.
h3. Expected Results

The ability to delete entity properties using automation rule actions.
h3. Actual Results

It's possible only to create and update entity properties, but the delete action doesn't exist.
h3. Workaround

Use a send web request Delete action to the endpoint "https://your-domain.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/issue/\{issueIdOrKey}/properties/\{propertyKey}".
API details [here|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/api-group-issue-properties/#api-rest-api-3-issue-issueidorkey-properties-propertykey-delete].
fields.summary: Option to delete properties using automation action Set entity property

fields.description:
When choosing an assignee, pressing TAB should select the highlighted option. 

 

The HOME and END keys, as well as SHIFT+HOME and SHIFT+END do not work when trying to clear the text in the field.
fields.summary: I want to be able to reorder the shortcuts I've added to the left nav

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When creating a custom field via a connect app and setting it's value as link (using a template), the content of this field is not displayed as a hyperlink, whereas in old view this same field value is a clickable link.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a custom field with a "link" template via a connect app.
 # Populate the value with a URL

h3. Expected Results

The field value is a clickable link
h3. Actual Results

The field value is a label like value
h3. Workaround


Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Custom field with "link" values are not displayed as hyperlink in new issue view

fields.description: When using the official Slack connector it is possible to see the list of Slack accounts connected and confirm/revoke access. It would be good to be able to do this in an automated fashion through REST API.
fields.summary: Add REST API to Slack connector to be able to manage connections.

fields.description:
We are using a lot of filters in dashboards, and when we want to change a bit one of the filter, we have to recreate the filter and relink it to the dashboards.

I think it would be a good idea to add a change owner option, to not always link the new filters to every Dashboards we're using.
fields.summary: Change Owner of filter without recreate it

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The PUT /rest/api/3/issue/\{issueKeyOrId} API allows to set the value of Read-Only Text Field, but once you pass empty string the value is not cleared.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a read-only custom field (ie. text cf)
 # Add your CF to screens in a project.
 # Set field value "some mistery value" via PUT /rest/api/3/issue/\{issueKeyOrId}.
 # Set field value to "" via PUT /rest/api/3/issue/\{issueKeyOrId}

h3. Expected Results

The value is cleared (set to "none" or the request results in 400 with a proper error message, but I believe we should allow clearing the field value).
h3. Actual Results

The value of the field remains unchanged. 
h3. Workaround


Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: The value of Read only CF cannot be cleared via PUT /rest/api/3/issue/{issueKeyOrId}

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Sending an email to a large number of users using the Send email option leads to 'Page unavailable' error.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to Setting > General >Send email
 # Select groups so that the number of users to receive email is at least 300+.
 # Send the email.

h3. Expected Results

All the recipients should receive emails.
h3. Actual Results

Only some users receive email and the page gives 'Page unavailable' error. Browser log shows 504- Gateway timeout error.
h3. Workaround

Send email to a small set of users.
fields.summary: Sending email to large number of users using the Send email option leads to 'Page unavailable' error.

fields.description:
h1. User Story

As a Jira admin, I would like to be able to set a resolution for the "Sub-Task Blocking" workflow condition in addition\instead of status, because sometimes status is wildly inefficient.
h1. Context

The most common use-case for the "Sub-Task Blocking" workflow condition is (I think anyway) to make sure all sub-tasks are closed before the parent ticket can move past a certain point in your workflow.

However, picking statuses for this can be very inefficient; if you change the specific status your sub-tasks end in or add a new sub-task with a different workflow, you would need to make changes to any parent workflows with this condition.

Being able to do this at the resolution level would be inherently more scalable - people usually have less resolutions anyway, and then I could block on all unresolved issues in one click with no maintenance down the road.
fields.summary: Sub-Task Blocking Condition for Resolutions

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When mentioning a user in the description of an issue, it does not generate notifications to the mentioned user.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue;
 # Update the description mentioning a user that is not related to the ticket (this is important to avoid notifications from other sources).

h3. Expected Results

The mentioned user will receive a notification.

h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:

The mentioned user won't be notified.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Mentioning users in the issue description do not generate notifications

fields.description:
When I am viewing a ticket and click a link in the description or comments, I would like for the link to open in a new tab. Right now it opens in the current tab, which means I no longer have Jira open.

 

I know I can command+click to force it to a new tab, but seems like decent enough behavior to leave as the default.
fields.summary: Have links in a ticket open in new tab by default

fields.description: It'd be nice to be able to hide some plugin's on issue types where they are definately not needed
fields.summary: In the Issue Layout settings, I'd like to choose which plugins/third party extensions are hidden

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

With the implementation of rate-limiting in Jira Cloud, more and more customers are running into their cost budgets and 429 errors.

It would be great if there was some visibility (through a report, for instance) into which parts of a Jira instance are consuming the most resources (JQL queries, boards, dashboards, automation rules...) so that optimization opportunities can be identified and worked on.

The current situation is that customers run into 429 errors and can't even figure out why.
fields.summary: Give customers visibility on rate-limiting costs

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
While performing an action of any transition to itself, if there is a validation failure, the button associated to issue actions gets disappeared.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a self transition as documented in the page here: [Work with issue workflows|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-cloud-administration/docs/work-with-issue-workflows/]
 # Add a validator for this transition.
 # Now try to perform the issue action for the issue, so that the there is a validation failure message.


h3. Expected Results
Issue action button should be visible even after the validation failure.

h3. Actual Results
Issue action button disappears. 

h3. Workaround

Refresh the page to see the issue actions again. ( refer the screen recording attached)
fields.summary: Validation failure while performing a looping transition(Any transition to itself) causes the Actions button to disappear.

fields.description:
Currently if you try to add an attachment that is too large you get the message shown in the attachment.

This says 'We couldn't save your attachment Reload the issue then try adding it again'

This is not very user friendly nor is it very informative and is actually misleading (trying again wastes the users time)

It would be better to inform the user that the attachment size is too large for the currently configured maximum - either compress the attachment or contact your site admin.
fields.summary: Make the error more informative when the attachment size is too large

fields.description:
URL: https:<site_name>/secure/admin/ViewAttachmentSettings.jspa

Currently configuring the attachment size requires entering the size in bytes (see attachment). This is rather user unfriendly, possibly requiring admins to open a calculator.

Include a dropdown with kB, MB, GB to make entering the max attachment size more user friendly.

Additionally list the maximum supported attachment file size (2GB) on the settings page so that it is obvious to admins what the maximum is. This is only revealed after you try to enter a byte size higher than 2GB
fields.summary: Attachment size should have a unit drop-down

fields.description:
Hello,
It seems that Atlassian's emoji when added to a text field are not interpreted in the backlog view when displayed on the issue.
See attachements below.
Here the field "Statut de la recette" is a text field rendered as wiki style.
The emoji is displayed properly on the issue view but not in the backlog listing of the issue.

Can Atlassian make them rendered in this view as well as it was the case on server?
fields.summary: Wiki style text field are not rendered in the backlog view when displayed on an issue

fields.description:
h3. Suggestion

As of now, CSV export from issue navigator will extract the _log work_ details in the below format
;<date>;<random username>;<logged time>

It would be useful if there will an option to get the worklog author detail (especially Atlassian Account ID) along with this column. Basically, the way other ID's are extracted in the CSV file -
{code} Assignee,Assignee Id , Reporter,Reporter Id , Creator,Creator Id  {code}
fields.summary: CSV export (all fields) should have worklog author details

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Date and time picker field currently does not accept custom AM and PM times and has to be input in a specific format to display correctly.
h3. Environment

Jira Software Cloud
New Issue View
h3. Steps to Reproduce

In new issue view, results of inputs in a custom date time picker fields are:
 * 9:42 AM -> Blank input
 * 09:42 AM -> Works as expected
 * 9:42 PM -> Blank input
 * 09:42 PM -> Changes to 9:42 AM
 * 21:42 -> 9:42 PM

Outside of this, customers do have the option use a dropdown menu to select time in AM and PM in 30 minute increments.
h3. Expected Results

Customers should be able to input time in 12 hour formats into the date time picker without having to make any edits like the ones in the previous section.
h3. Actual Results

Inputs blanking out based on the format they are added in. 
(covered in Steps to Reproduce)
h3. Workaround

Currently the only workaround is shown in the steps to reproduce section,
i.e. by inputting time in specific formats as displayed.
fields.summary: Improve time entry format on new issue view's date time picker custom field

fields.description:
We have screen scheme template that are used for Risk, Service Now, Dependency etc issue types, as well for some departments. 
When trying to associate a template for an issue type from the available screen schemes need to go through each in the drop down, there is no way to type or search, which leads to confusion, going over the list of thousands of screen schemes multiple times to find one that is needed. 
[Project Settings > Screens > Associate an issue type with a screen scheme - select the issue type and {*}_screen scheme_{*}]

There need to be a way to quickly search by the keywords or type the scheme name in the drop down instead of going through a list of thousand items to find one. Please fix that! Thanks!
fields.summary: Issue Type Screen Scheme - configuration

fields.description:
Hi,

In order to mitigate security risks, we need to be able to restrict the export feature to Admins only rather than switching it off for everyone. I see you have some suggestions open already, I'd like to know if this something you're considering in the near future as it does have an impact on internal and customer security risk assessments.

Many thanks,

Sandrine
fields.summary: Restrict Export feature as part of roles/permissions

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Searching for exact phrases with hyphens using JQL fetches not exact values. According to our public documentation hyphen is not a special character and should be usable to match exact searches using JQL
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set any Jira field to a value with a hyphen
 ## e.g. "Test-123"
 # Have another issue with this field set to any variation of this value
 ## e.g. "TestABC-123"
 # Create a JQL advanced search trying to match this field value
 ## e.g. field ~ "\"Test-123\""
 # The result will bring both issues, not only the one with the exact match.

h3. Expected Results

JQL should fetch only exact results.
h3. Actual Results

The search fetches all combinations of the value, not only exact match.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.

There are a couple of marketplace apps that can help work around this problem.
fields.summary: Searching for exact phrases with hyphen using JQL fetches not exact values
create new issue from comment

fields.description:
Please refer to the description and discussion in JSWSERVER-2521.

This feature would be just as helpful for Jira Cloud.
fields.summary: As a project manager I would like to spread one Kanban WIP limit across multiple subcolumns

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition:

On Filters Page, Issue Details View leaves a lot of white space on both sides of the page.
h3. Suggested Solution:

Expand the issue detail view to the full page just like the Issues Tab
h3. Workaround:

No Workaround
fields.summary: Issue Detail View on Filters page shows white spaces on either side

fields.description:
Problem definition:
If there are many log entries for a specific change a Jira admin needs to manually click *Show more* on each log line to search in more detail.

Suggested Solution:
Add a button *Show more for all log lines* or *Expand all log lines*.

Why is this important:
Easier use of the Audit log and search using the browser's text search.

Workaround:
Manually click on *Show more* for each logline.
fields.summary: Audit log expand all log entries option - 'Show more' button for all log entries at once.

fields.description: Tokens can be passed in as a parameter in the web request URL. The request here is to be able to hide certain parameters so that those who can view webhooks will not be able to see the tokens used.
fields.summary: Provide ability to hide parameter from web request URL

fields.description:
In the Old Issue View, the *Resolution* is displayed as *Unresolved* when is not set but in the New Issue View, the resolution is not displayed until it has a value.

As a Customer, I want that the *Resolution* will be displayed as *Unresolved* when is not set in the New Issue View.
fields.summary: Ability to display the Resolution as Unresolved

fields.description:
In self hosted Jira – In the description or steps to reproduce section or a Jira card, there is an option to click a paperclick icon and then see the list of attachments on that Jira card and select one. This would then embed in the image or whatever, inline, with your text, which makes reading through the story of a Jira card more fluid. 

 

Observed: Jira cloud - you can only embed an image/attachment easily by uploading the image at the time of when you want to embed. If you upload AND THEN want to embed into the Jira card, there is no option to embed after the fact. 

 

*Ask:* Add the option in Cloud Jira, to click paperclip icon, see the list of attachments already uploaded to the Jira card, to then select one and have it embed into the inline where said cursor is.
fields.summary: Cloud Jira - Embed already uploaded Images/documents option

fields.description:
*Summary of Ask:* Add the ability in Cloud Jira to include attachments from source Jira into cloned jira. 

 

In self hosted Jira - when cloning Jira cards, there is an option to include attachments. If selected, this would clone the Jira and then in the cloned Jira it would contain the source Jiras attachments. 

 

In cloud Jira - there is no ability to clone a Jira and have said clone get created with the source Jira's attachments.
fields.summary: Clone Jira - Copy over Attachments Option to the Clone

fields.description: need a log to see which all users have signed up to Jira from all of the invited users within an organization in the Jira Service Management Project
fields.summary: signed up to Jira from organizations

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

You can have custom fields with restricted contexts making them usable by specific issue types/projects.

Currently, if you delete a project (one or more) that was the only project selected under a field's context, the context will present the message *Not configured for any context*:
 !Screen Shot 2021-11-16 at 11.04.28-1.png|thumbnail! 

Although the behaviour is expected, notice that the field will be unusable even for advanced JQL searches. And the user might not be aware of fields that could be using a restricted context to the project that's being delete. 

In that scenario customers will get confused on why the field is not working anymore, making them contact our support for assistance.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 
* Edit a custom field's context so it will be restricted to only one project
* Delete that project you selected under the field's context

h3. Suggestion

Warn users about fields that have restricted contexts towards the project they are deleting so they know what needs to be fixed afterwards.
fields.summary: Warn users about fields' contexts when trashing/deleting a project

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

According to our documentation the [Get users from group|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/api-group-groups/#api-rest-api-3-group-member-get] REST API endpoint is requiring _Administer Jira_ [global permission|https://confluence.atlassian.com/x/x4dKLg], as well as {{ADMIN}} scope for Connect apps and {{manage:jira-configuration}} for Oauth.

This is not consistent with the fact that:
 # the [Administer Jira Global permissions|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-cloud-administration/docs/manage-global-permissions/] documentation page actually says that you only need _*Browse users and groups*_ ** global permission: 
{quote}"Users with _*Administer Jira*_ permission can perform most administration tasks, except managing users"
{quote}
 # you can actually use the REST API endpoints [Find users and groups|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/api-group-group-and-user-picker/#api-rest-api-3-groupuserpicker-get] and [Get user groups|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/api-group-users/#api-rest-api-3-user-groups-get] without ADMIN rights (as expected/documented). So that you can still get the same result using a combination of 2 other endpoints without having admin rights.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In the REST API documentation page for the [Get users from group|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/api-group-groups/#api-rest-api-3-group-member-get] REST API endpoint, if you click on the "{*}[Permissions|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/intro/#permissions] required:{*} _Administer Jira_ [global permission"|https://confluence.atlassian.com/x/x4dKLg] link, this brings you to the [Administer Jira Global permissions|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-cloud-administration/docs/manage-global-permissions/] page that, as mentioned above, says that you only need _*Browse users and groups*_  global permission. 
 # The [Get group members|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/api-group-group/#api-wiki-rest-api-group-member-get] REST API endpoint for Confluence Cloud does not need ADMIN rights either.
fields.summary: Why are there different security scopes for Jira and Confluence APIs in cloud? Could it be changed?

fields.description:
On the Shared filters page, when we try to search for filters owned by a user, the *Owner* field value is reset and shows blank.

It would help the users to display the username selected in the *Owner* field when the filter results are displayed.
fields.summary: Owner field on shared filters page is reset when a search is performed
Allow the quick search to show the same pre results when typing in the search box

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

CSV importer doesn't import *Select List (cascading)* field data correctly.
This problem happens only when we use {{Issues}} > {{Import Issues from CSV}} on the top page.
This problem never happens when we import CSV using {{System}} > {{External System Import}} in the Administration page.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a project
 # Add *Select List (cascading)* custom field and set their options
 # Associate the custom field to the project you created on step1
 # Import CSV from {{Issues}} > {{Import Issues from CSV}}

h3. Expected Results

The CSV data should be imported to JIRA correctly.
h3. Actual Results

*Select List (cascading)* custom field data (especially the child option) was not imported. 
See the screenshot attached: [^Select List (cascading) CSV import failed.png]
h3. Workaround

Use {{System}} > {{External System Import}} in Administration page instead.
fields.summary: CSV importer doesn't import "Select List (cascading)" field data correctly.

fields.description: There are changes Atlassian wants to perform to Jira. Then there are changes customers want to do to Jira. Possibly the best way to bridge the gap is to create a Jira Change Advisory Board consisting of both Atlassian team members and Customers.
fields.summary: Organize a Jira Change Advisory Board Including Customers

fields.description:
Currently Team-Managed projects in Jira Software do not have a concept of issue layouts but do have layouts per issue type.

Customers using Team-Managed projects would benefit from a copy layout feature, similar to the company managed project's copy issue layout feature, as covered by [*JRACLOUD-71630*|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-71630]
fields.summary: Implement copy layout feature in Team managed projects

fields.description:
Ability to change the order of the sub-task.
h6. When we try to change the order it will not be changed as we can see in this [video|https://share.getcloudapp.com/v1ujE2oO].
fields.summary: Ability to change the order of the sub-task

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition:
Changing a field assignee, reporter, or any other custom field cannot trigger a workflow screen to be shown.
h3. Suggested Solution:
Allow assignee, reporter, or any other custom field change to trigger a workflow screen to be shown.

h3. Why is this important:
Allow conditions in the screen to be met before a field can be changed like adding a comment etc.

h3. Workaround:
No workaround is available.
fields.summary: Screen popup on an assignee, reporter, or custom field change.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Recently, the multi line text field is renamed to Paragraph. This change does not appear in the field type section of the existing fields which is quite misleading. It would be great if the change is reflected on the existing fields as well.
fields.summary: change the field type name in existing fields

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When you have two or more multi select custom field in create issue screen, we are unable to choose the options from both the fields. Rather it is only allowing us to choose from one field only. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create two custom fields with type Select list (multiple-choice)
 # Add to create issue screen
 # Click on "Create" , try to choose an option in both the fields, it will only allow you to choose from one field only. 

h3. Expected Results

We should be able to select an option from both fields.
h3. Actual Results

[^2021-11-12_21-14-09.mp4]
h3. Workaround


Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Unable to choose an option on two multi select custom fields during issue creation

fields.description:
Currently, it is not possible to add a default reporter to the "Comments from emails" mail handler. 

When a Mail hander is configured to use the *default mail server* and an unlicensed user replies to an email, the "Comments from emails" handler is invoked, the email cannot be processed because this handler cannot determine the actioner. As a result, the mail will be discarded.

*Suggestion:* It would be great to add a default reporter to the "Comments from emails" mail handler. 

*Temporary Workaround:*

Use a custom mail server.
fields.summary: Ability to add Default reporter to the "Comments from emails" mail handler

fields.description:
h3. Problem

In its current state, the *Link issues* action does not allow for remote issue links. This is to say creating an issue link between an issue in the current cloud instance with another cloud instance connected.

Any attempts in doing this will result in an error:
{noformat}
Issue does not exist or you do not have permission to see it., You must provide one of 'inwardIssue' or 'outwardIssue'. (issuelinks)
{noformat}

h3. Proposed solution

When using this action there should be an option similar to the UI in Jira to specify if the issue link is local or from a connected instance to allow remote issue linking.
fields.summary: Add support for remote issue links

fields.description:
Problem definition:
No ability for the Mail Handlers to process emails to create private comments in Jira tickets.

Suggested Solution:
Allow Mail Handlers to process emails to create private comments in Jira tickets.

Why is this important:
Ability to hide comments from large groups of users when creating them via email.

Workaround:
No workaround is available.
fields.summary: Ability for the Mail Handlers to process emails to create private comments in Jira tickets.

fields.description: When receiving a notification about a multi user field update, the notification should include what has changed, showing "what it was" value and the "what it is" value, so you don’t have to compare the changes manually, as it’s now.
fields.summary: Highlight the changes in notification

fields.description:
Selecting an option from the select list custom field does not get highlighted. Hence it is difficult to understand what option has been selected in the list unless the list is collapsed.

Providing a *_colour highlight_* when any option is selected in the select list custom field will be helpful.
fields.summary: Selecting an option from the select list custom field does not get highlighted.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Opening the Messaging extension in the Jira chat box within Microsoft teams renders the user profile icons incorrectly

The issue is reproducible if you will open the Messaging Extension in a personal conversation with the Jira chatbot. The issue is not reproducible if you open Messaging Extension in a group chat.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Integrate Jira cloud with Microsoft Teams
* Open the Jira chat-box in Teams
* Click on the Messaging Extension within the Jira chatbot in Teams

h3. Expected Results
Recent Jira tickets are shown with Summary, issue key, and assignee profile icon rendered correctly.

h3. Actual Results
Recent Jira tickets are shown, however, the issue assignee icons are not rendered correctly.

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Opening the Messaging extension in the Jira chat bot within Microsoft teams renders the user profile icons incorrectly

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When some users try to transition issues, the comments field available at the transition screen is populated with the user's avatar initials logo, blocking the comments field to be edited. It also blocks the option to switch between Internal/Public comments options in some cases.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Error is intermittent, not able to reproduce it.
h3. Expected Results

Be able to add the comments normally
h3. Actual Results

!image-2021-10-21-09-04-19-032.png|width=519,height=442!

!image-2021-10-21-09-05-16-539.png|width=518,height=438!
h3. Workaround

1. Customers can add comments after the transition is executed.
 2. Refreshing the page also fix this problem in some cases.
 3. If the comment is required during the Workflow transition, it's necessary to change it to optional and apply step #1.
fields.summary: Avatar initials logo blocking comments field during workflow transition

fields.description:
h1. User Story

As a Jira Cloud user, I would like to be able to see only my own filters by default because that's both better and the behavior I've been trained to expect when I was on Jira Server or Data Center.
h1. Context

The "View Filters" option on Jira Server is conceptually "view all of _your_ filters" with an option to search the instance for other people's filters if I want. This makes a lot of sense - when I'm going to look at filters, statistically I'm going for my own a lot more than I would be for someone else's. Showing the entire instance is also a bit overwhelming to users.

However on Jira Cloud, this has been renamed "View All Filters" and takes you to a screen listing every single filter in the system.
h1. Proposed Solutions
 * By default, filter the list by owner so that users are presented first with their own list.
 * Give people the option to set their own "default filtering" so that they can decide what they see first.
fields.summary: Allow for Default Filters on "View All Filters" Screen

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The list of apps that's usually visible by clicking on "Apps" in the top navigation menu disappears when zooming in. 

The issue has been tested in Chrome and Firefox with the same results: on a 22" screen having resolution 1920x1080 the apps disappear when zooming to 150%.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open Jira in your browser, click on "Apps" in the top navigation menu and see the list of installed apps:
!jira-cloud-bug_app-visible.png|width=364,height=61!
# Zoom in until "More" appears as top navigation item.
# Click on "More" and then "Apps", see that the the list of apps is now barely visible and scrollbars that you cannot really scroll appear:
!jira-cloud-bug_app-almost-gone.png|width=295,height=86!
# Zoom in at least one more time, and once again click on "More" and then "Apps"

h3. Expected Results
The same list of installed apps from step #1 is visible

h3. Actual Results
The list of installed apps disappeared:
!jira-cloud-bug_app-gone.png|width=297,height=111!

h3. Workaround
No workaround, you can only zoom out
fields.summary: List of available apps disappears from the Apps menu (top navigation menu) when zooming in

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

It seems there was a regression of the fix for JRACLOUD-39112 (closed as {*}Fixed{*})

On moving Issue to another project, JIRA doesn't check the permission for Assignable User. JIRA should not fill that Assignee field during moving an issue, if the former assignee doesn't have *Assignable User* in project B.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue in projectA
 # Give UserA *Assignable User* permission for projectA
 # Assign the created issue in projectA to UserA
 # Create projectB
 # Move Issue from projectA to projectB

h3. Expected Results

Assignee field should be left blank as they original assignee doesn't have permission in projectB.
h3. Actual Results

The original assignee is still assigned the issue in projectB although he doesn't have *Assignable User* permission in projectB
h3. Workaround

No workaround available.
fields.summary: JIRA doesn't check the Assignable User permission when moving issues between projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The numerical operation divide is rounding the results for the Original Estimate field. 

(i) It's not happening with the math expression "/"
(i) Other fields like Story points seem to be working fine.

 !image-2021-11-11-13-46-33-196.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a rule and create two log actions
 # First log action: {code} {{issue.Original estimate.divide(3600)}} {code}
 # Second log action: {code} {{#=}}{{issue.Original estimate}} / 3600{{/}} {code}
 # Set the original estimate field for an issue and use this issue to trigger the rule
 

h3. Expected Results
The log action should show a float number in case a result is a float number.

h3. Actual Results
The log action shows a number rounded.


h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: The numerical operation divide is rounding the results for Original Estimate field

fields.description:
A lot of apps are installed in a lot of different projects. Some project teams like to have certain apps prominently displayed at the top and others like to move them further down the screen.

It would be great if there is a way to control the ordering of the apps on issue screens.
fields.summary: To reorder app UIs on the issue screens

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Excel connector for Jira not working for online export.
Desktop export working as expected.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Click on export to Excel
 # Error thrown at the login

h3. Expected Results
The issues should be exported to excel online

h3. Actual Results
The issues are not exported to excel online

h3. Workaround
Use desktop version to export to Excel
fields.summary: Excel connector for Jira not working

fields.description:
There is an issue update endpoint that allows Connect apps to skip user notification, override screen security and override editable flag (admin scope required for the last two): https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v2/#api-rest-api-2-issue-issueIdOrKey-put

We use custom fields to enable Jira API for our app (users read/write custom field and our app reacts to /issue-updated webhook). We use the `notifyUsers` flag to skip notification emails.

Everything works well except the fact that custom field update adds an entry in users notification section and issue history. In our case, the traffic is so high, that users complain and ask us to stop writing to the notifications section, but at the same time, they want to keep API access (custom fields integration).

Would it be possible to either introduce a new flag or use `notifyUsers` flag to skip adding entries to the users' notifications section (and issue history)?
fields.summary: Allow to skip adding entries to the users notifications section when updating issue

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Automations web panel in old issue view loads intermittently. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Open the issue in the old issue view.
* Try to access the Automation field.

h3. Expected Results
It should show the automation rules that have been executed on the issue.

h3. Actual Results
The automation field does not load.

Looking at browser dev tools, you'll see the GET request to https://automation.atlassian.com/pro/rest/<project id>/macros/form fails with 403 error.

h3. Workaround

 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Automations web panel in old issue view loads intermittently.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently in a team managed project, only either one of the epic or versions panel could be enabled.
!image-2021-11-11-17-39-40-420.png|width=400! 
!image-2021-11-11-17-39-46-359.png|width=400!
h3. Suggested Solution

It would be nice to allow both panels to be enabled and shown on the screen
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: In Team Manage Projects, allow both Epic and Versions panels to be enabled

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When there are multiple similar Create issue actions in an automation rule, it's not possible to tell them apart in the left-hand sidebar in an automation rule. Each Create issue action will need to be opened to see what is being created.

 !multiple_issue_create_actions.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
Adding a truncated issue summary to the left-hand sidebar summary would make it easier to see which issue is being created by which action.

h3. Why this is important
This improvement will make it easier to manage large automation rules that create multiple issues.
fields.summary: Automation's create issue action sidebar summary should include the truncated issue summary

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Slack integration will work even if IP address of Slack user is blocked by IP Allowlist

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Turn on the premium feature [IP Allowlist|https://support.atlassian.com/security-and-access-policies/docs/specify-ip-addresses-for-product-access/]
 # With an IP address that is blocked by the Allowlist, open Slack and type "/jira connect" as per [https://support.atlassian.com/jira-work-management/docs/integrate-jira-cloud-and-slack/|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-work-management/docs/integrate-jira-cloud-and-slack/]
 # Login to your Atlassian Account and accept the Slack Jira Integration
 # The Slack user is now connected to the Atlassian Account and can perform commands such as "/jira create"


h3. Expected Results
Slack user should not be able to perform any commands to create, preview, and receive notifications from Jira, since the user's IP address is blocked.

h3. Actual Results
Slack user is able to perform commands to create, connect to project, and receive notifications.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Slack integration will work even if IP address of Slack user is blocked by IP Allowlist

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If a user does not have the Create Issue permission in a project, the *Create Child Issue* button will be replaced by the *Create Subtask* button in the Epics.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an Epic in a Company-Managed project;
# Remove the Create Issue permission from the user;
# Access the Epic

h3. Expected Results

The following buttons will be displayed:
 !Image 2021-11-10 at 5.49.50 PM.jpg|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

The following buttons are incorrectly displayed:
 !Image 2021-11-10 at 5.50.01 PM.jpg|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

The only available way to work around this behavior is to give the *Create Issues* permissions for the users who have access to the project.
fields.summary: Epics display "Create Subtask" button when Create Issues permission is not given in a project

fields.description:
h3. Problem
We would like to know the history of dashboard changes like when it was created, updated etc


h3. Suggested Solution
_(Add a suggested solution once one has been determined)_

h3. Why This Is Important
_(Add a description for why this is important)_

h3. Workaround
_(Add a workaround, if available)_
fields.summary: Need to view history of JIRA dashboard changes

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Gadgets using filters that include Business Projects do not allow issues to be edited directly from the gadget.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Business project;
# Create a filter that retrieves issues from this project (e.g project = <project_key>)
# Create a Dashboard and add Filter Results gadget using the newly created filter
# Use the "..." on one of the results and select *Edit*.

h3. Expected Results

An edit issue screen should open.

h3. Actual Results

The page keeps loading indefinitely.

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available. However, it is possible to edit the issue directly from the project itself.
fields.summary: Gadgets using filters that include Business Projects do not allow issues to be edited

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When building an app, if you set the size of the content to be displayed (e.g. the size of a web panel) in the issue view to something bigger than 1500px then scrollbars are displayed, making it difficult to navigate through the view. This is because the div around the iframe is locked to a specific height of 1500px.

Also, when resizing the view with AP.resize() and setting the value to something more than 1500px, the option to hide the app stops working.

For further details see below thread in the developers community:
 - [App max height in atl.jira.view.issue.left.context|https://community.developer.atlassian.com/t/app-max-height-in-atl-jira-view-issue-left-context/38772]

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an app that displays some content in the issue view (location: atl.jira.view.issue.left.context) using, e.g., a web panel
 # Try to set the size to something more than 1500px

h3. Expected Results

The Web Panel should be allowed to grow in height, the main column should be larger in width (or be allowed to grow) and preferably there would be no scroll-bars for each column
h3. Actual Results

Web Panels have to their content in a very tight space in terms of width, can only grow in height up to so much, and multiple scroll-bars are visible in the issue view screen
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Apps Max Height limited to 1500px in issue view (atl.jira.view.issue.left.context)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

On slow systems, a project workflow with *Log Work* screen in a workflow transition becomes unresponsive and users won't be able to log time
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a screen adding *Log Work* field and add the screen to a workflow transition
 # In the project's field configuration, make the field *Log Work* mandatory/required
 # On the project board, try to open an issue and transition/drag and drop an issue so that the *Log Work* screen shows up (These actions should be immediate so that Log Work screen overlaps issue view modal)
 # Try to add time in the *Time Spent* field

h3. Expected Results

Users should be able to log time on the *Log Work* screen when transitioning issues across board columns
h3. Actual Results

The *Time Spent* field is not clickable and users cannot log time on the *Log Work* screen. Also, we see a secondary window open (issue view screen) below the Log Work Screen 
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: On slow systems, workflow transitions with Log Work screen become unresponsive to log time

fields.description:
Currently in the web request we can add only 'Authorization' in the Headers with a basic token of a Jira admin account. It would be good if the web service call can be made using credentials of the triggering user.
 Ex: The triggering user, will have access to see components in target project anyway. This will help the Jira admin token to be not exposed unnecessarily.
fields.summary: Option to send a Web request as a user who triggered the rule under the action-Send web request

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When searching for a hidden field in Advanced Search, the JQL query shows that the hidden field is searchable for the projects that the customer has migrated from Jira Server to Cloud, however, this should not be the case as hidden fields are not supposed to show. Basic search does not allow hidden fields to be searchable.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # 
 **  Navigate to a project 'Test' (migrated from Jira Server to Cloud) 
 ** The field configuration has the Priority field hidden.
 ** Using Advanced Search, search :
{code:java}
project = Test and priority = High
project = Test and priority is not empty
project = Test and priority is empty {code}

 * 
 ** Click on Search.

h3. Expected Results

The Advanced Search should be shown as  !image-2021-11-10-13-10-52-441.png!   and the warning message 'hidden field is not searchable' as the field is hidden and there will be no results returned.
h3. Actual Results

The Advanced Search will be shown as correct   !image-2021-11-10-13-11-04-836.png!  and user can proceed to search. This should not be the case as a search with a hidden field will not return any results.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: The JQL query shows that the hidden field is searchable for the projects migrated from Jira Server to Cloud

fields.description:
Currently in order to perform configuration of installed App in Jira Administrator permission is required.
There can be situations when designated person needs to perform configuration of an installed app and providing administrative access to whole site is not best practice.
fields.summary: Separate permissions to configure Apps

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The issue in the JWM board moves to any other status where it does not belong as per workflow.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue in the JWM project.
 # Move the issue where it cannot transition to the status as per workflow on the JWM board.

h3. Expected Results
Ideally, the issue should not move any other status where it does not belong as per workflow, while transitioning from the board.

h3. Actual Results
The issue stays on that status for a few seconds while transitioning and later go back to its previous status

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Issue bounces back on transition after a few seconds in JWM Board.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Any variable outside branch (before) is required to access the value of any variable created inside a branch after the branch execution ended.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a variable inside the branch
 # Access the value outside the branch. It's only accessible if any other variable was created before the branch even if it's not used.

h3. Expected Results

Either no variable should be required before the branch, or it should be the same variable that requires to be created before the branch (global context)
h3. Actual Results

If no variable is created before the branch then the variables created inside the branch context cannot be used outside the branch.

!image-2021-11-09-19-35-15-915.png|width=315,height=190!
h3. Workaround

create any variable before the branch
fields.summary: It's required to create any variable before branch to access a variable created inside branch after the branch execution ended

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When trying to select values for Select List(Multiple choice) custom field on a create screen , previously selected value for a field gets de-selected.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have 2 fields of type Select List(multiple choice) on create screen
 # Select values from 1st field from the screen.
# Then select the value from 2nd field.

h3. Expected Results
The values from the fields should stay selected.

h3. Actual Results
Values from 1st select list field gets de-selected. Please refer the attached video recording

h3. Workaround
Try different browser and versions. For example , the issue is replicable in Chrome 95.0.4638.54 (64bit). The same issue is not replicable on Chrome v91 and Mozilla v94.

This happens 100% of the time when using the following browsers:
* Opera (all versions)
fields.summary: We cant select values on Select List (Multiple choice) custom field from Create issue screen on some browser versions

fields.description:
h4. Problem Description

We have come across scenarios where our notification sending IP addresses are added in the blacklist and are considered as SPAM. As a result, customers utilising that spam filter disregards our email that falls into that sending IP address range.

This leads to customers email notifications cannot be received. Getting those IPs delisted from these providers sometimes takes time and till then, the customers do not receive notifications. The only workaround is to whitelist Atlassian IP address [range|https://support.atlassian.com/organization-administration/docs/ip-addresses-and-domains-for-atlassian-cloud-products/] but that is also sometimes not a feasible option.
h4. Suggested Solution

Improve the current situation to ensure smooth experience for users/ JSM customers to receive notifications.
fields.summary: Improvement in the case Atlassian mail sending IP address get blacklisted

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When changing an issue type from one type to another, in the *Update fields* page, the fields (which are usually marked as required) are not listed in the same order as the order they were arranged in the View Issue Screen.

Note that this behaviour is only experienced during the Move operation. Once the operation has been completed, the fields are listed in the correct order.

!Screen Shot 2021-11-09 at 4.52.44 pm.png|width=179,height=219!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Say, if you wanted to change an issue type from Task -> Bug, modify the field configuration scheme for Bug to make certain fields mandatory
 # Update the Screen for the Bug issue type to arrange the fields in a manner that you want
 # Create a Task issue type and then perform a Move operation to change issue type to Bug
 # During the *Update fields* section of the procedure, the mandatory fields are not ordered in the same way as you configured them in [2] and they're listed in a random order

h3. Expected Results

For ease of use, the fields should be listed in the same order as they are configured in the View Issue Screen. 
h3. Actual Results

The fields are listed in a random order
h3. Workaround

No known workaround
fields.summary: Fields are not listed in the correct order in the Update fields page when changing an issue type

fields.description:
As a Jira Cloud user, I would like to be able to set my own share defaults for dashboards, filters, and other similar objects.

This is available for Jira Server and Data Center, and I'm not really sure what about Cloud would suggest that the same use-cases wouldn't __ be...it's still a pain to need to set share permissions each time.
fields.summary: Per-User "Shared to..." Default Settings Missing for Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Users are unable to use the "Configure" option in MS Teams - Jira cloud add-on for setup when using the Jira search functionality in the Teams messaging extension. Trying to set up results in a pop-up window that loads indefinitely.

This affects users that have access to 2+ Jira cloud sites under the same account.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Install MS Teams for Jira add-on in Jira cloud instance
* Install the Jira cloud addon in Microsoft Teams
* Verify that Teams has been updated to version: 1.4.00.22368
* Open Jira cloud chat in Teams and click on the Jira symbol from the Messaging extension
* Click on Configure

h3. Expected Results
A window pops up to facilitate successful setup 

h3. Actual Results
A window pops up but fails to load and a buffering icon is seen

h3. Workaround
Use the Jira cloud chatbot in MS Teams to set up the instance (by sending a message "Configure" within the Jira cloud chat). 
Once the configuration is complete, use the Jira search functionality provided in the Messaging Extension for the rest of the operations 

OR

Login to browser-based MS Teams to perform the configuration by sending "Configure" in Jira Cloud chat to initiate the bot configuration dialogue. Once completed, the configuration menu in the desktop app should load as expected again.
fields.summary: Unable to setup jira instance within Teams when using Jira cloud addon after the recent microsoft update
